questions.question: A cylinder has a radius of 3 cm and a height of 5 cm. What is the volume of the cylinder?
questions.hint: Use the formula for the volume of a cylinder: π × radius² × height.
questions.explanation: The volume of a cylinder is calculated as π × radius² × height. Here, radius = 3 cm and height = 5 cm. So, volume = π × 3² × 5 = 141 cm³.

questions.question: Find the volume of a cone with a radius of 4 cm and a height of 9 cm.
questions.hint: Use the formula for the volume of a cone: (1/3) × π × radius² × height.
questions.explanation: The volume of a cone is (1/3) × π × radius² × height. With radius = 4 cm and height = 9 cm, volume = (1/3) × π × 4² × 9 = 151 cm³.

questions.question: A cylinder has a height of 7 cm and a radius of 2 cm. Calculate its volume.
questions.hint: Apply the formula for the volume of a cylinder: π × radius² × height.
questions.explanation: The volume of a cylinder is π × radius² × height. Here, radius = 2 cm and height = 7 cm. So, volume = π × 2² × 7 = 88 cm³.

questions.explanation: The volume of a cylinder is π × radius² × height. Here, radius = 6 cm and height = 4 cm. So, volume = π × 6² × 4 = 452 cm³.

questions.explanation: The volume of a cone is (1/3) × π × radius² × height. With radius = 2 cm and height = 7 cm, volume = (1/3) × π × 2² × 7 = 29 cm³.
